content.newsInsight: UK just announced 5,000 NHS staff cuts despite record waiting lists. Everyone's debating healthcare efficiency. Wrong variable. When you're cutting headcount while demand explodes, you're not solving a budget problem. You're creating a capacity crisis that'll cost triple to fix.
content.patternInsight: You're still reading. That already puts you ahead.
content.intelligenceExample: The NHS cuts, for example. We read that and our mind goes to: what's the real cost when fixing next year's crisis requires 15,000 emergency hires at premium rates?
content.consultingInsight: We were just reading how McKinsey helps healthcare systems optimize staffing models through predictive analytics. Brilliant frameworks, proven ROI. But what if every hospital administrator could access that level of strategic thinking before making cuts that compound into crises?
